data.title: Alle Hsu on LinkedIn: üíê Rabindranath Tagore was one of my great
data.meta_description: üíê Rabindranath Tagore was one of my great-grandfathers closest friends/mentors. I love this quote by him.
data.text:
I am so thrilled to share that my NYU Tisch School of the Arts NYU Tisch Film & TV thesis film #POP! is finally hitting film festivals with its World Premiere at NewFilmmakers Los Angeles (NFMLA) on Saturday, August 3rd in Block 3 at 7:30pm. POP! is my most personal work so far, and I‚Äôm honored and humbled to finally be able to share with an audience. Logline/Synopsis POP! follows the travails of an unemployed, thirtysomething Chinese American woman living at home with her mother, as she obsesses over ways to remedy or mask her adult acne in time for a family friend‚Äôs Chinese New Year banquet, where she hopes to reunite with an old high school crush. I couldn‚Äôt have made this film without ‚Äî Credits Directed By üôãüèª‚ôÄÔ∏è Written By Michael Cumes Story By üôãüèª‚ôÄÔ∏è Directed By üôãüèª‚ôÄÔ∏è Produced By üôãüèª‚ôÄÔ∏è, Roxy Shih Executive Produced By üôãüèª‚ôÄÔ∏è, Lily Hsu, Tony Hsu Cinematography By Enrique Unzueta Edited By Brett Noborikawa, Zekun Mao Production Design By Yao Zhang Art Direction By Liang Guo Set Decoration By Colleen Kwok Costume Design by Matthew Mathiasen Costuming By Julie Vesselle UPM Golie Yazdy Assistant Directed By Arnold Chon Script Supervision By Amelia Ferroni Hair and Makeup By Veronica Rodarte Gaffer Jesse Lee Grip and Electric Cole Stamm Additional Grip Nicholas Popkey 1st Assistant Camera Shirlyn Wong 2nd Assistant Camera Abhinav Mellacheruvu Steadicam Operators Colin MacDonnell Parker Brooks Sound Mixer/Boom Operator Patrick Joyner Sound Design By Diana Cha Music By Diana Cha, George Shaw Main and End Titles Joy Yang Production Assistants Annie Ahnn Madeline Rocco Starring: Michelle Ang, Cindera Che, Amir Malaklou Grace Shen Cast: Leann Lei, Anne Marie Bohrk, Acacia Garden Fisher, Sung Min Danny Park, Desmond Chiam, James Tang, Mike Ginn Production Companies: NYU Tisch School of the Arts, Alexandra House Productions Company 3 Method Studios ‚Ä¶ and so so many more üí´ Poster Design By Xan Black Recipient of the NYU Tisch Dennis Riese Production Award Thank you so much to the whole #NFMLA team and family, for consistently believing in me and my work - for accepting each of my short films. Larry Laboe, Bojana Sandic, Emma Hughes, George Gomez, Lauren Muniz Links: Festival Link: https://lnkd.in/gieawS68 Tickets Link: https://lnkd.in/gRS7k-8U Facebook Event Page: https://lnkd.in/g4T2hF3G

Popping back into LinkedIn to share some news - My latest festival short film #RencontresPaysannes #FarmersDating has premiered at 3 festivals so far. The short film had its World Premiere at BendFilm Festival, its International Premiere at Foyle Film Festival, and will now have its California/Los Angeles Premiere at NewFilmmakers Los Angeles (NFMLA). This is the third short film I've had in the festival. I'm so grateful to the team for believing in me and my work. Larry Laboe Bojana Sandic Danny De Lillo George Gomez Emma Hughes. Thank you to my team on this project for being so patient and for all of your hard work on this. Excited to continue to share this film with more places around the world. Hoping to make comedy a little more universal through exploring common issue of technology and modernity disrupting traditional worlds. üòÄ Marion Servole William Prunck Christopher Vennemeyer Xu Muffin Enrique Unzueta Marc Wiltshire Elisa Rice Imran J. Khan Paula Armand DUTEIL Becker Kyrah A. Louise K. Mambi Poppy van Oorde-Grainger Laura Mohai Alexander Kalachnikov Sebastian Perez Burchard ALPHA STUDIOS, LLC Kaitlyn Yang Adhish Y. Kanda F. Alvin Wee Ilaria Camplone Nathana√´l de Tarade +++ Link to the LinkedIn Event Page: https://lnkd.in/gAsCj-Rc Link to the Festival Page: https://lnkd.in/gmArfC6d Link to EventBrite for Tickets: https://lnkd.in/getcy9Jp --- Past Press -- BendFilm Press Release: https://lnkd.in/gGenMCVv Foyle Film Festival Press Release: https://lnkd.in/gn2eprKK Foyle Film Festival Program: https://lnkd.in/gxsYvtyV

Didn‚Äôt get around to posting about the event on the socials. It‚Äôs been quite the ride over the last few weeks to get this all together ‚Äî Along with my project partner Anthony Ma , we wanted to commemorate the 40th year mark of Vincent Chin‚Äôs tragic murder that triggered the first nationwide Asian American civil rights movement. On Thursday, we hosted a series of virtual conversations with key players who contributed or were a part of Vincent Chin‚Äôs life, case, and the movement. We are so grateful to have found partners for our event. Thank you to NextShark for giving us a home. The event was live on Zoom and on Facebook through our event page ‚Äî https://lnkd.in/geFBxxGh. The recording is up on the event page, so if you missed, feel free to check this out! Unfortunately, the first 30 mins weren‚Äôt live/recorded, due to a technical glitch (technology is hard). What you may have missed is that Gary Koivu was unable to join the conversation to speak about Vincent - we would‚Äôve loved to learn who Vincent was through him. It was a last minute surprise for us as well, so we had to rush to solve the situation. Luckily during our research journey, we‚Äôve recorded most of our interviews for our own research purposes, and little did we know, we would eventually use them in this kind of way. With every door that‚Äôs closed opens a new one. Although Gary didn‚Äôt join us, it did give us the opportunity to play some clips from our interview with him and give you a glimpse of what we‚Äôve picked up along the way. Some of the photos that we showed are from our personal research album, articles, stills from ‚ÄúWho Killed Vincent Chin?‚Äù and photos we‚Äôve found from Google. We‚Äôve been doing research on this case for several years now and we‚Äôve had the pleasure of meeting some incredible people along the way who have compelling stories that add to the Chin legacy. Through these conversations, we hope to expand on whats currently known about this pivotal and historic case. Thank you to our guests Christine Choy and Theodore Merritt. Thank you to our webinar manager Jaclyn Amor. Thank you to our graphics designer Tiffany Wang. Thank you to our promotional partners UCLA Asian American Studies Center Asian America: The Ken Fong Podcast 1882 Foundation Chinese American Museum Washington, DC. And a special thanks to YOMYOMF FOUNDATION Strong Asian Lead Prof King-Kok Cheung Ryo S. Clifford Lo Julian Chan Joshua Van Gundy Ashley Hermosura and of course our family members Tony Hsu Judy Wong YO YO JY Zhang We could not have done this without all of you. And thank you to the 85 of you who tuned in live on zoom, the 35 of you who tuned in live on facebook, and the 1000+ viewers since! ‚ú®‚ú®‚ú® #vincentchin #lilychin #americancitizensforjustice #whokilledvincentchin #garykoivu #christinechoy #theodoremerritt #history #americanhistory #asianamerican #asianamericanhistory #asian #civilrights
